group.name: itsp-account
group.label: ITSP Account
group.description: The information that is specific to a given ITSP account.

setting.name: max-number-of-concurrent-calls
setting.label: Maximum calls
setting.description: The maximum number of concurrent calls allowed via the given ITSP. This is a way of doing a coarse granularity of QOS on a per ITSP basis. When the limit is reached, sipXbridge will return "Service Unavailable".

setting.name: outbound-proxy
setting.description: If the ITSP specifies an outbound proxy, enter it here.

setting.name: authentication-realm
setting.description: If undefined, sipxbridge will read the domain from the authentication challenge.

setting.name: user-name
setting.label: User
setting.description: The user name attached to the account.

setting.name: display-name
setting.label: Display name
setting.description: The optional display name for this account.

setting.name: use-global-addressing
setting.label: Global addressing
setting.description: If checked, use the stun determined global address for SIP signaling and SDP.

setting.name: is-reinvite-supported
setting.label: re-INVITE Support
setting.description: If checked, reINVITE is supported by the ITSP. This allows sipxbridge to delay codec choice for call setup when dealing with call transfers.

setting.name: route-inbound-calls-to-extension
setting.label: Incoming calls destination
setting.description: Determines where to send inbound calls. If empty, inbound calls are directly routed to the specified number in the inbound request and have to be redirected by aliases or dial plan rules.

setting.name: register-on-initialization
setting.label: Register on initialization
setting.description: Defines whether or not to register with the given ITSP on initialization.

setting.name: use-registration-for-caller-id
setting.label: Use Registration for caller-ID
setting.description: Defines whether or not to use the Registration username and domain as a caller ID.

setting.name: sip-keepalive-method
setting.label: Method to use for SIP keepalive.
setting.description: Defines the mechanism to use for SIP keepalive. If undefined, REGISTER is used if the account is marked register-on-initialization else, if OPTIONS is Supported, OPTIONS is used else CR-LF is used.

setting.name: rtp-keepalive-method
setting.label: Method to use for RTP keepalive.
setting.description: Defines the mechanism to use for RTP keepalive.
